candidates.name: Kevin Taylor
candidates.why_elect: After 44 plus years with NZ Police I have the governance and management skills combined with people skills to add value to this community. I have volunteered extensively over many years in ventures directly impacting on Taupō. Civil defence, emergency management and traffic safety are my strengths.
candidates.why_stand: Since moving to Taupō 27 years ago my wife Raewyn and I have made Taupō our turangawaewae. We have raised our 5 children here and want to continue investing time and energy in the Taupō community. I have skills, experience and the time to devote to this role.

candidates.name: John Williamson
candidates.why_elect: Taupō has been my home for 56 years,as a current two term Councillor I believe in getting out into the community to listen to the issues that affect our residents and ratepayers.

candidates.name: Kathy Guy
candidates.why_elect: I am fresh and future focused and believe in sound planning for the rapidly changing social and economic needs of the district. I bring demonstrated leadership from my role as a CEO and governance from active involvement at national level in tourism and Taupō council boards including Taupō Economic Development.
candidates.why_stand: Taupō is unique in NZ in terms of its tangata whenua, location and natural resources. I know it as a community of caring people. I value the authenticity of what Taupō represents to its residents and its visitors. I want to ensure that Taupō does not lose these values.

candidates.name: Mowenna (Mo) Harding
candidates.why_elect: I am a sincere, intelligent, passionate and practical everyday person who believes council should be representative of all our community including everyday people just like me, not simply those with ties to big business. As a councillor I will be fair and considerate of the district as a whole.
candidates.why_stand: I believe a fundamental breakdown in communication currently exists between council and our community and this needs to change, starting with open and clear conversations. We live in a special place, and we all have a right to be better informed on issues and decisions that affect our home.

candidates.name: Rosanne Jollands
candidates.why_elect: My reputation is as someone who challenges the status quo and someone who listens, is approachable. An RMA Commissioner, trustee for Life Education Trust, a management degree, majoring in economics and 30 years' business and governance experience, I bring to the table a healthy dose of common sense.
candidates.why_stand: We need fresh thinking and a council that is listening to your needs. Our district needs a high-performing council that provides real value for you and our community. We need sound and timely decision-making, not bureaucracy and red tape. That's the kind of leadership I commit to delivering for you.

candidates.name: Anna Park
candidates.why_elect: You can trust me to listen, act and always in the best interests of Taupō. I'm a third-term councillor with a family and a near perfect 100% attendance record. A team player with a strong, independent voice that supports thriving communities, always with honesty and accountability, Positive and well informed.
candidates.why_stand: I'm passionate and proud of our District. I'm committed to the safety of our communities, the protection of our natural environment, and the intergenerational processes of council in this modern day. I'm a strong advocate for enhancing facilities; economic development; improved transportation including walking and cycling; water quality and infrastructure.

candidates.name: Jan-Marie Quinn
candidates.why_elect: I am a former business owner so I know about management and making important decision so things work for the best. I am a very hard worker and strive for perfection in whatever I do. I have a political background once working for a government organisation.
candidates.why_stand: I love Taupō. Over the years I have been involved in many local ventures that have needed support from council. I became very interested in what makes the community tick and decided I wanted to be part of making important decisions for the better of the community.

candidates.name: Christine Singer
candidates.why_elect: I am a great listener and enjoy finding solutions to problems. My major strength is seeing ideas through to fruition and I am a clear concise decision maker. I relate well with people of all ages and cultures and am passionate about helping young people, reach their potential.
candidates.why_stand: Taupō District is one of the best districts in NZ and I am passionate about keeping it vibrant and attractive to visitors and locals with a pristine Lake for enjoyment of all.
